places.title: Apple Park
places.description: Apple Park is a futuristic corporate headquarters of Apple Inc. located in Cupertino, California. It spans over 175 acres and houses more than 12,000 employees in a massive ring-shaped building with a diameter of 1.5 km. The building's design is inspired by the natural environment and is aimed at minimizing its impact on the surrounding landscape. It features one of the world's largest naturally ventilated buildings, with a roof that is covered with solar panels, generating enough electricity to power the entire facility. The park is surrounded by over 9,000 trees, including over 300 varieties of indigenous and drought-resistant species. It features a central courtyard with a pond and a circular pathway, along with a fitness center, an auditorium, and a café for employees. The park's construction cost is estimated to be around $5 billion and was opened to the public in 2017. It has won several awards for its innovative design and sustainability efforts, including the 2018 Good Design Award, the 2018 Structural Awards Supreme Award, and the 2019 Urban Land Institute Global Awards for Excellence. Apple Park has become a symbol of Apple's commitment to innovation, design, and sustainability. It has also become a popular destination for tourists and Apple enthusiasts, who can take guided tours of the facility and its surrounding park.

places.title: Microsoft HQ
places.description: The Microsoft HQ Campus in Redmond, Washington, is the corporate headquarters of Microsoft, one of the world's largest and most successful technology companies. The sprawling campus covers over 500 acres and is home to more than 50,000 employees. The buildings are modern and striking, with glass facades and innovative design features that reflect Microsoft's commitment to cutting-edge technology. The campus is divided into several neighborhoods, each with its own unique design and amenities. The Commons is the hub of the campus, with numerous shops, restaurants, and services for employees. The Treehouse is a unique workspace surrounded by nature, while Studio B is a state-of-the-art recording studio used for Microsoft's events and podcasts. The campus also features sports facilities, including a gym, indoor basketball court, and soccer field, as well as walking trails, outdoor seating areas, and a pond. The Redmond Ridge East campus, located nearby, offers additional amenities, including a café, fitness center, and outdoor space. The Microsoft HQ campus is not only a great place to work, but it also serves as a model for sustainable design and environmental responsibility. The campus uses renewable energy sources, including solar power, and features innovative water management systems that reduce water consumption. Overall, the Microsoft HQ campus in Redmond is a modern, forward-thinking workplace that offers employees an innovative and inspiring environment to do their best work.
